intro: Aglossorrhyncha serrulata, commonly known as the serrated aglossorrhyncha, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves with serrated margins. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
